intro: Astragalus perbrevis, commonly known as the short-stemmed milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, harsh environments. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus perbrevis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its native habitat.
